video.title: Swift Tutorial - Full Course for Beginners
video.description:
Learn how to code with Swift in this full tutorial course for beginners. Swift is a powerful and intuitive programming language for macOS, iOS, watchOS and tvOS.

This course covers all the core concepts of Swift including:
Variables and Constants, Data Types, Properties, Functions and Parameters, Classes, IF Statements, and more.

Course from Code With Chris. Check out their YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/user/codewithchris

The Code With Chris Facebook community: https://www.facebook.com/groups/codewithchriscommunity/

--

Learn to code for free and get a developer job: https://www.freecodecamp.org

Read hundreds of articles on programming: https://medium.freecodecamp.org

replies.author: AJ Fernandez
replies.text: understand the frustration. I finished chris's swift video already on his channel and am doing this one to make sure all the info is concrete and memorized, maybe this video has something the last one does not. What im trying to say is this is a 3 hour video for a language that is worth more than 3 hours. The fix is that there is literally 1000 different videos all going over different things. You are not going to learn everything you need from this video. Learn what it has and then move to another. You wont understand swift until your on your 3rd or 4th video

topLevelComment.author: Eduard Qualls
topLevelComment.text:
*( )* = *parenthesis* _pl_ *parentheses* _not_ "rounded bracket"
*{ }* = *brace* _not_ "curly bracket"
*[ ]* = *bracket*
(A _brace_ is not a _curly bracket_ any more than a _dog_ is a _barky cat_  or an _m_ is a _lumpy n_ )

topLevelComment.author: Jonathan Gerard
topLevelComment.text: I long to learn Swift. But sadly, I do not have an Apple device like a Mac or iPhone. C#, though primarily used for creating Windows Apps, can be used on both Mac and Windows, because of tools such as Rider, VS Code and Visual Studio. I really wish Apple should create a cross-platform Swift IDE for programming with a virtual iOS device, just like Android Studio.

topLevelComment.author: Officially Nmotion
topLevelComment.text: I don't understand "import UIKit" at the top of every script. I know generally in a language it implies that you're going to use the UI elements in some way but seems out of place unless thst is Apple being weird again. In Python, unless I'm using TKinter for a UI I wouldn't add it to my code because otherwise it would throw an error since it's unused (Flake8, PEP8) can anyone who codes explain this to me?

topLevelComment.author: Officially Nmotion
topLevelComment.text: If you're already a beginner of another language, python for me, watch this video at 1.25X speed. I like the content but because the syntax is similar and intuitive, it drives me crazy how slow some people teach. I understand though not everyone learns the same. Happy coding guys, girls, and all.

replies.author: Phat
replies.text: @GurgMaster Swift is not more modern than C#. It's just a replacement for real old Objective C. Not much changed during last 10 years. Swift is just an attempt to make more convenient language for Mac  and iOS as C# for Windows or Kotlin for Android.

replies.author: Phat
replies.text: @GurgMaster It's a very strange decision to start with Swift. I think any programmer should start with easiest language like C, understand core concepts and then move on to OOP, functional programming and so on.

replies.text: It's been one year but for people who have this questions: When u start working on projects with tens of thousands of lines, you'll want to better organize your code and for example if you are storing information about all the students in a class, you'd rather create a Student class and create an instance for each student instead of creating 500 different variables and try to manage them.

repeat while was the dumbest thing why didn’t they adopt C do while made more sense they just gone back to using repeat keyword that wasn’t technically correct as the code is saying do this code while condition is true were now they adopted repeat it say repeat this code while condition is true but what if condition is false at the start then code execution is one time, nothing ever repeated

do...while made more sense to me as was a better keyword than the days I used repeat one of the things C got right now swift just gone back to using repeat, how many prefer do

replies.author: Nathanator
replies.text:
Insoft Abd yes, you’re right. ; is optional in Swift, and it’s automatically added in JavaScript. Although, you can use ; in Swift if you want to have multiple lines of a single line. Ex:

var cat = “ 🐱 “; print(cat)

replies.author: Yujiko
replies.text:
It happened to me, I updated Xcode, tried it again and when I ran it a pop up window appeared and asked permission to use a debugger application or something like that, typed my password and worked perfectly.
If updating doesn't work (or already updated) try reinstalling it and should most definitely work, if not, then try contacting apple support (if you can). If that also fails and you really really need that to work, format your computer.
If everything above fails, just walk up to your nearest corner and start sobbing.
